examples: You definitely struck a sour note when you brought up Dan's ex-girlfriends during your best man speech.
Like Castle, Wilson had been brought up in a similar way, and they spoke the same language.
I thought about bringing up my concerns but decided instead to let sleeping dogs lie.
We all sat sipping our tea quietly, no one wanting to bring up the white elephant in the room about Joel's expulsion from college.
And if I ever felt tempted to bring up the situation, I zipped my lips before any words emerged.
words.defineEn: to look after a child until they reach maturity
words.defineVi: chăm sóc một đứa trẻ cho đến khi chúng trưởng thành

examples: When the police informer saw a friend, he took off like a rat up a drainpipe.
He will make a fortune if his invention takes off.
I watched the planes take off and land from the observation deck at the airport.
I always feel excited when the airplane takes off.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
words.defineEn: to become famous and successful in a sudden and rapid manner
words.defineVi: trở nên nổi tiếng và thành công một cách đột ngột và nhanh chóng

examples: We drop off our son at preschool in the morning and pick him up in the afternoon.
We can kill two birds with one stone by dropping off the mail when we go to the grocery store.
And as, the water, drops off.
Oh, that one dropped off.
And truckloads of tuna are dropped off every hour.
words.defineEn: to take a person or thing to a predetermined location and leave afterwards
words.defineVi: để đưa một người hoặc vật đến một địa điểm được xác định trước và rời đi sau đó

examples: In our lectures we need to get over the importance of online safety.
Still can't get over the idea that someone thought bullying real life children was an acceptable thing to do.
He reminded himself that he that stays in the valley will not get over the hill, and enrolled in advanced classes.
The company must stop shooting itself in the foot if it wants to get over its troubles.
I can’t get over how well you look.
words.defineEn: to cross a physical barrier, such as a wall, fence, or obstacle
words.defineVi: để vượt qua một rào cản vật lý, chẳng hạn như một bức tường, hàng rào, hoặc chướng ngại vật

examples: He reached over and turned off his bedside light.
Jill must have been in another world when I asked her to turn off the oven because the bread is burned now.
"Turn off?"
Once inside, he turned off the security alarm.
Don't turn off the captions.
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to stop operating, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị ngừng hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc vặn chìa khóa

examples: Can you lend me your red pen to fill out this form?
Three: fill out an annoyingly long contact form.
It is filling out forms.
Okay, well, just fill out these forms.
As part of the intake process for the program, caretakers fill out a form detailing information about the participant and their past.
words.defineEn: to complete an official form or document by writing information on it
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành một hình thức chính thức hoặc tài liệu bằng cách viết thông tin về nó

examples: The treatment has not yet been tried on patients.
She tried on different hats at the store to find the perfect fit.
She tried on several dresses before finding the perfect one.
Now you try on the overalls.
But I am going to try on hearing aids for the first time today.
words.defineEn: to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits and how it looks
words.defineVi: mặc một bộ quần áo để xem nó có vừa không và nó trông như thế nào

examples: My little son was looking up at the sky and showing me the fluffy white clouds.
She looked up from her work and gave a yawn.
I looked up at the night sky and saw a shooting star.
She held it, cast an eye over it and looked up at Harry suspiciously.
The girl looks up.
words.defineEn: to try to find information in a dictionary, computer, etc.
words.defineVi: để cố gắng tìm thông tin trong từ điển, máy tính, v.v.

examples: For 10 years she looked after her children, with her career very much on the back burner.
I'll look after Jamie while you go shopping.
John has been up to his knees looking after the kids lately.
He is a self-interested liar, whose sole motive throughout his life has been looking after number one.
The employees in that department act as if the devil looks after his own, covering up incompetence and wrongdoing by their coworkers rather than reporting issues through proper channels.
words.defineEn: to be in charge of someone and attend to their needs or to take care of something
words.defineVi: chịu trách nhiệm về ai đó và đáp ứng nhu cầu của họ hoặc chăm sóc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to carefully check something
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra cẩn thận một cái gì đó

examples: The detective took after the burglars.
He plans to take after his father, who was a master sergeant in the Marine Corps.
I was afraid that if I started running the man would take after me.
And take after take, he would just get a huge ovation from the crowd.
They heard from former President Trump, who, among others, took after Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader.
words.defineEn: to choose someone as an example and follow their behavior or choices
words.defineVi: để chọn ai đó làm ví dụ và làm theo hành vi hoặc lựa chọn của họ

examples: He picked up a beautiful head of savoy cabbage from the market.
They picked up the check for dinner last night.
Whenever we go out, my father picks up the tab.
The city had to pick up the pieces after a major storm caused widespread damage and power outages.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
words.defineEn: to take and lift something up
words.defineVi: để lấy và nâng một cái gì đó lên

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to enter a bus, ship, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để vào xe buýt, tàu, máy bay, v.v.

examples: The old man gave up the ghost.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Er, don't give up the day job!
We gave up the right to use the valley.
words.defineEn: to stop trying when faced with failures or difficulties
words.defineVi: ngừng cố gắng khi đối mặt với thất bại hoặc khó khăn

examples: I got through school by the seat of my pants.
You're not getting through here with me standing.
It seems like every time I'm in a rush to catch a flight, the security line is extra long, and I always get stuck behind someone who's taking forever to get through.
Get through the skin.
They got through everything.
words.defineEn: to succeed in passing a difficult experience or period
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc vượt qua một kinh nghiệm khó khăn hoặc giai đoạn

words.phonetic: tə tʃeɪndʒ wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs maɪnd
words.defineEn: to change one's opinion or decision regarding something
words.defineVi: để thay đổi ý kiến hoặc quyết định của một người về một cái gì đó

words.phonetic: tə peɪ ɐtɛnʃən tʊ ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to carefully watch, consider, or listen to someone or something
words.defineVi: cẩn thận xem xét, xem xét, hoặc lắng nghe ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to experience a pleasurable or enjoyable event or activity
words.defineVi: để trải nghiệm một sự kiện hoặc hoạt động vui vẻ hoặc thú vị

examples: When you're out, they moan because you're not there.
You guys should just stop moaning and get a life!
When you're in the house your parents moan about you being under their feet.
Ladies, don't moan.
Darth Vader doesn't moan.
words.defineEn: to make a low sound that often expresses pain, grief, or disappointment
words.defineVi: để làm cho một âm thanh thấp mà thường diễn tả nỗi đau, đau buồn, hoặc thất vọng

words.defineEn: to do something that guarantees the happening of something else or that guarantees something will not happen
words.defineVi: để làm điều gì đó đảm bảo sự xảy ra của điều gì khác hoặc điều đó đảm bảo điều gì đó sẽ không xảy ra

examples: That shot lost him the championship.
lose that creep!
His carelessness lost him the job.
The government has lost control of the city.
The business is losing money.
words.defineEn: to be deprived of or stop having someone or something
words.defineVi: bị tước đoạt hoặc ngừng có một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Patience isn't exactly her strong suit.
Patience hasn't always been my strongest point.
It took patience and care to separate the tiny seeds from the ripe tomato.
It took patience and precision to crack open the tough shell of the single-leaf pinyon pine cone.
The different cabling systems are becoming more and more of a problem, testing the patience of planners and private network operators to the extreme.
words.defineEn: the tolerance to accept things that are difficult or annoying without expressing complaint or anger
words.defineVi: sự khoan dung để chấp nhận những điều khó khăn hoặc khó chịu mà không bày tỏ sự phàn nàn hay tức giận

words.phonetic: tə duː wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs bɪt slæʃ pɑːɹt
words.defineEn: to fulfill one's share of responsibilities
words.defineVi: để hoàn thành phần trách nhiệm của một người

examples: The toddler giggled as she wiggled her tiny toes in the sand.
The baby giggled and clapped its hands in delight.
The girl giggled with delight as she unwrapped her birthday presents, revealing a new bicycle.
She stopped giggling.
The little girl giggled as the chickens pecked at her hand.
words.defineEn: to laugh in a foolish way and with catching short breaths as a result of nervousness or embarrassment
words.defineVi: cười một cách ngớ ngẩn và thở dốc do lo lắng hoặc xấu hổ

examples: Now I have to walk home soaked to the bone!
You can reduce the bitterness of sour gourd by soaking it in saltwater before cooking.
It's recommended to soak the purple onion slices in cold water to reduce their sharpness before using them in salads.
The rain soaked through her boots, making her feet wet.
She blended soaked wheat berries into her favorite smoothie.
words.defineEn: to make someone or something extremely wet
words.defineVi: để làm cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó cực kỳ ẩm ướt

examples: My superstitions about Greta's accident have died down.
On December 16, the triumphant cheers died down in Europe.
'I'm going to die down here.'
The hype over the location of Amazon's HQ2 has died down, but the e-commerce giant actually just opened its biggest office building yet.
But after about ten years, use died down, because people noticed that, it still hailed.
words.defineEn: to gradually decrease in intensity, volume, or activity
words.defineVi: để dần dần giảm cường độ, khối lượng, hoặc hoạt động

examples: Jack never felt satisfied devoting his time and attention to one thing, so instead he's scratched the surface of a number of hobbies and interests.
You devoted your life to this?
I devote a fair amount of attention to that.
There have been lots of books about you, scholars have devoted their lives to you.
As I listened to the speech, he devoted three pages of the speech to the economy.
words.defineEn: to assign or allocate something, such as resources or funds, for a particular purpose or use
words.defineVi: để chỉ định hoặc phân bổ một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như tài nguyên hoặc quỹ, cho một mục đích cụ thể hoặc sử dụng

examples: My mom stuffs pimientos with cream cheese and serves them as an appetizer at parties.
I know my stuff.
Ah, that's the stuff.
I stuffed the aubergine with a savory mixture of rice, vegetables, and herbs, creating a flavorful meal.
She's an excellent teacher - she really knows her stuff.
words.defineEn: things that we cannot or do not need to name when we are talking about them
words.defineVi: những thứ mà chúng ta không thể hoặc không cần gọi tên khi nói về chúng

words.phonetic: tə kiːp ɐn aɪ ɔn ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to closely watch a person or thing, particularly in order to make sure they are safe
words.defineVi: để theo dõi chặt chẽ một người hoặc vật, đặc biệt là để đảm bảo rằng họ được an toàn

examples: Are all your chores done?
He often helps his neighbors with their chores.
They were always arguing about money, chores, and even the smallest things.
As a devoted wife, she takes care of the household chores and ensures a comfortable home for her family.
I have so many chores to do, and my sister won't lift a finger to help me.
words.defineEn: a task, especially a household one, that is done regularly
words.defineVi: một nhiệm vụ, đặc biệt là một hộ gia đình, được thực hiện thường xuyên

examples: Buses take priority over other vehicles on the road.
Students with disabilities have priority access to the lift.
Priority is given to traffic already on the roundabout.
The government has given top priority to reforming the tax system.
Our priority will be to raise a boundary wall and prevent trespassing.
words.defineEn: the fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important than others
words.defineVi: thực tế hoặc điều kiện được coi hoặc coi là quan trọng hơn những người khác

words.defineEn: to cause someone to become extremely irritated, frustrated, or agitated
words.defineVi: để gây ra một ai đó để trở nên cực kỳ khó chịu, thất vọng, hoặc kích động

words.defineEn: used to refuse or decline to provide an answer or explanation to a question, often because the person being asked does not know the answer
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để từ chối hoặc từ chối cung cấp câu trả lời hoặc giải thích cho một câu hỏi, thường là do người được hỏi không biết câu trả lời
